question.title: Count Words
question.content:
For a given input string(str), find and return the total number of words present in it.

It is assumed that two words will have only a single space in between. Also, there wouldn't be any leading and trailing spaces in the given input string.

Input Format:
The first and only line of input contains a string without any leading and trailing spaces.
Output Format:
The only line of output prints an integer value denoting the total number of words present in the string.
Note:
You are not required to print anything. It has already been taken care of.
Constraints:
0 <= N <= 10^3
Where N is the length of the input string.

Time Limit: 1 sec
Sample Input 1:
Coding Ninjas!
Sample Output 1:
2
Sample Input 2:
this is a sample string
Sample Output 2:
5

rephrased.body: Given a string, determine the number of words present in it. It's guaranteed that words are separated by a single space, and there are no leading or trailing spaces.
constraints: N is the length of the input string.

testcases.explanation: The input string contains two words: 'Coding' and 'Ninjas!'.
The input string contains five words: 'this', 'is', 'a', 'sample', and 'string'.
The input string contains one word: 'one'.
An empty string contains no words.
The input string contains six words
